p: GC-MS analysis identified 12 different compounds, which accounted for 97.8% of the total chemical composition of the thyme oil sample tested ( Table 1). Thymol (34.6%) was the most abundant compound, followed by p-cymene (30.8%), terpinene (15.6%), linalool (9.4%) and carvacrol (2.5%). The other 7 components, α-pinene (1.4%), ethyl gallate (1.3%), benzoic acid (1.2%), α-thujene (0.3%), camphor (0.3%), camphene (0.2%) and borneol (0.2%) were identified in lesser amounts. A few unknown compounds (2.2%) were found as trace or minor components.
